result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
9 days CFTS in the event of revocation
Concurrent with: Waushara County Case 21CF253

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician. DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.
Costs paid in full - Bond previously posted in the amount of $3,000 has been applied. Excess bond refunded to poster.

defendant.name: Ostertag, Richard R., Jr.
defendant.address: N3913 County Road MM, Wautoma, WI 54982

records.addlTxt: CHK#14124  bond refunded to poster S.O. se
Count 2
18 Month Post Plea Diversion Agreement - Count 1
Count 2
Count 1

Cases 21CF134, 21CF253, 22CF54, 21TR1558, & 22TR1221 called @ 9:09 AM Defendant Richard R. Ostertag Jr. in court.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Richard R. Ostertag Jr.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. As to cases 21CF253 & 22CF54: The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State, the Court amends Count 3 in case 21CF253 and Count 2 in case 22CF54 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping contrary to Wis. Stat. 946.49(1)(a).  Plea: 21CF134 - Count 1 - NC. 21CF253 - Counts 2 & 3 - NC. 22CF54 - Counts 1&2 - NC. 21TR1558 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC as to Case 21CF253 and Count 2 in case 22CF54. Court accepts plea and stays judgment as to case 21CF134 and Count 1 in case 22CF54. 21CF134 - Count 2 - DRI. 21CF253 - Count 1 - DRI. 22TR1221 - Dismissed Outright. Sentencing argument by ADA Ryan. Sentencing argument by Atty Blankschein. No statement by the DE. As to case 21CF134 and Count 1 in case 22CF54: The Court accepts the terms of the PPDA. Matter stayed for 18 months. As to case 21CF253 and Count 2 in case 22CF54: Court orders: S/W - 2 years probation. Conditions: AODA and follow through. Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. DNA Sample and Surcharge.  As to case 21TR1558: Court orders: Forfeiture and costs of $893.00. 7 month DL revocation. OWI Assessment. The parties agree to 6 days CFTS on case 21CF253 and 9 days CFTS on case 22CF54 in the event of revocation. Appeal rights given.
Order for Reassignment of Cases from Judge Dutcher to Judge Blader signed by Chief Judge Dutcher on 8/1/2022 filed in 2022GF27.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Richard R. Ostertag Jr. in court.  Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Richard R. Ostertag Jr. Atty Blankschein requesting a P/S hearing.
Status conference on July 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by phone for Richard R. Ostertag Jr. Atty Blankschein advises they are waiting on Treatment Court Referral. STC scheduled.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.
